meanings.definition: The action or practice of deceiving others by pretending to be someone or something one is not.
meanings.sent1: The imposture of the magician amazed the audience.
meanings.sent2: She saw through his imposture and exposed him as a fraud.
meanings.sent3: The imposture of the talking dog at the circus made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His imposture as a wealthy businessman was shattered when his true identity was revealed.
meanings.sent5: The imposture of the shape-shifting alien in the movie was truly captivating.

meanings.definition: A fraudulent or deceptive act or practice.
meanings.sent1: The imposture of the con artist fooled many unsuspecting victims.
meanings.sent2: The company was fined for their imposture in misleading customers with false advertising.
meanings.sent3: The imposture of the fake fortune teller was finally uncovered by the police.
meanings.sent4: His imposture as a doctor led to dangerous consequences for his patients.
meanings.sent5: The imposture of the counterfeit painting was revealed by expert art historians.
